question: 数珠
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>number</kanji> of <kanji>pearls</kanji>, put together on a string. This refers to a <vocabulary>rosary</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>prayer beads</vocabulary>. You'll see these a lot in Japan, for sale or with monks wearing them.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for this word is different from both of the kanji readings you learned. This word sounds a lot like <reading>Jews</reading> (<ja>じゅず</ja>), so we'll have to go with that. Just imagine a Jewish rosary or prayer beads, with a Jewish person using it.
